New Records: Jordan Walker became the first player in nearly 100 years to go 5-for-5 with a home run, three RBI, and four runs against the New York Yankees.
Key Match Events: Jordan Walker went 5-for-5 with a home run, three RBI, four runs, and a stolen base in the series finale against the Yankees.
The St. Louis Cardinals won 14-7 against the New York Yankees to claim the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals' win on Saturday was their first-ever victory at the new Yankee Stadium and their first road win against New York since Game 5 of the 1964 World Series.
Jordan Walker is the only player among Al Simmons and Jimmy Dykes to also steal a base in the same game.
